YEAR: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27; TITLE: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {paper["url"]}') print(f&#x27; CONFIDENCE: {paper.get("confidence", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27; TYPE: {paper.get("type", "paper")}') print(f&#x27; YEARS FOUND: {paper["years_found"]}') print(f&#x27; SNIPPET: {paper["snippet"][:150]}...') print(f&#x27; SOURCE QUERY: {paper["search_query"][:50]}...') # Identify the earliest publication "keyword">if sorted_papers: earliest_paper = sorted_papers[0] earliest_year = min(earliest_paper.get(&#x27;years_found', [])) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ EARLIEST PUBLICATION IDENTIFIED:') print(f&#x27; YEAR: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27; TITLE: {earliest_paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {earliest_paper["url"]}') print(f&#x27; CONFIDENCE: {earliest_paper.get("confidence", "unknown")}') detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] = { &#x27;earliest_year': earliest_year, &#x27;title': earliest_paper['title'], &#x27;url': earliest_paper['url'], &#x27;confidence': earliest_paper.get('confidence', 'unknown'), &#x27;type': earliest_paper.get('type', 'paper') } "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No early papers found "keyword">in detailed search') print(&#x27;May need to examine the Google Scholar profile more closely') # Save detailed search results detailed_file = &#x27;workspace/pietro_murano_earliest_title_search.json' "keyword">with open(detailed_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(detailed_search, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ DETAILED SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {detailed_file}') print(f&#x27;üìà SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Targeted queries executed: {len(detailed_search["search_queries"])}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Early papers found: {len(detailed_search["earliest_papers"])}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {len([q "keyword">for q "keyword">in detailed_search["search_queries"] "keyword">if q["status"] == "success"])}') "keyword">if detailed_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): answer = detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ FINAL ANSWER:') print(f&#x27; Pietro Murano\'s earliest publication ({answer["earliest_year"]}): {answer["title"]}') print(f&#x27; Confidence: {answer["confidence"]}') print(f&#x27; Type: {answer["type"]}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Earliest publication title "keyword">not definitively identified') print(f&#x27; May require direct examination of Google Scholar profile "keyword">or CV') print(&#x27;\n=== EARLIEST PUBLICATION TITLE SEARCH COMPLETE ===')

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print(&#x27;=== PHASE 2: IDENTIFYING PIETRO MURANO\'S FIRST PUBLICATION TITLE ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Extract specific title of Pietro Murano\'s earliest authored paper') print(&#x27;Previous search identified 2002 "keyword">as earliest year, now need specific paper title') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # First, inspect the saved search results file structure results_file = &#x27;workspace/pietro_murano_earliest_publication_search.json' "keyword">if os.path.exists(results_file): print(&#x27;STEP 1: INSPECTING PREVIOUS SEARCH RESULTS FILE') print(&#x27;-' * 60) "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: previous_search = json.load(f) print(f&#x27;File structure: {list(previous_search.keys())}') print(f&#x27;Total publication findings: {len(previous_search.get("publication_findings", []))}') "keyword">if previous_search.get(&#x27;chronological_analysis'): analysis = previous_search[&#x27;chronological_analysis'] print(f&#x27;Earliest year found: {analysis.get("earliest_year_found")}') print(f&#x27;Early years: {analysis.get("total_early_years")}') print(f&#x27;Earliest publications count: {len(analysis.get("earliest_publications", []))}') # Examine the earliest publications "keyword">if analysis.get(&#x27;earliest_publications'): print(&#x27;\nEarliest publications found:') "keyword">for i, pub "keyword">in enumerate(analysis[&#x27;earliest_publications'], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. Title: {pub.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; URL: {pub.get("url", "No URL")}') print(f&#x27; Years: {pub.get("early_years_found", [])}') print(f&#x27; Snippet: {pub.get("snippet", "No snippet")[:100]}...') print() "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Previous search results file "keyword">not found') previous_search = {} print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;STEP 2: TARGETED SEARCHES FOR PIETRO MURANO\'S EARLIEST PAPERS') print(&#x27;='*80) # Get API key api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">is "keyword">None: print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key") "keyword">else: print("‚úì API key available") # Initialize new search results detailed_search = { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;objective': 'Find specific title of Pietro Murano\'s first publication', &#x27;target_years': [2002, 2003, 2004, 2005], &#x27;search_queries': [], &#x27;earliest_papers': [], &#x27;final_answer': "keyword">None } # Search Strategy 1: Focus on Google Scholar "keyword">with specific early years query1 = &#x27;"Pietro Murano" site:scholar.google.com 2002 2003 2004 first publication' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 1: {query1}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params1 = { "q": query1, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response1 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params1) "keyword">if response1.status_code == 200: results1 = response1.json() detailed_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query1, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results1.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response1.status_code} - Success") "keyword">if results1.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results1[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results1[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') link = result.get(&#x27;link', 'No URL') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i}. TITLE: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}") # Look "keyword">for specific paper titles "keyword">and early years combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}" # Extract years 2002-2005 "keyword">import re early_years = re.findall(r&#x27;\b(200[2-5])\b', combined_text) early_years = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in early_years] # Check "keyword">if this looks like an actual paper ("keyword">not just a profile) paper_indicators = [&#x27;paper', 'article', 'conference', 'journal', 'proceedings', 'study', 'research'] has_paper_indicator = any(indicator "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in paper_indicators) "keyword">if early_years "keyword">and has_paper_indicator: print(f" üìÑ POTENTIAL EARLY PAPER:") print(f" Years found: {sorted(set(early_years))}") print(f" Paper indicators: {[ind "keyword">for ind "keyword">in paper_indicators "keyword">if ind "keyword">in combined_text.lower()]}") detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers'].append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': link, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;years_found': sorted(set(early_years)), &#x27;search_query': query1, &#x27;confidence': 'high' "keyword">if 'scholar.google' "keyword">in link "keyword">else 'medium' }) "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response1.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 1: {str(e)}") # Search Strategy 2: Look "keyword">for specific paper titles "keyword">from early 2000s query2 = &#x27;"Pietro Murano" author 2002 2003 2004 2005 HCI usability interface' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 2: {query2}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params2 = { "q": query2, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 12, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response2 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params2) "keyword">if response2.status_code == 200: results2 = response2.json() detailed_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query2, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results2.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response2.status_code} - Success") "keyword">if results2.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results2[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results2[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') link = result.get(&#x27;link', 'No URL') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}" # Look "keyword">for early years "keyword">and Pietro Murano early_years = re.findall(r&#x27;\b(200[2-5])\b', combined_text) early_years = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in early_years] has_pietro = &#x27;pietro murano' "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">if early_years "keyword">and has_pietro: print(f"\n{i}. üìÑ EARLY PAPER CANDIDATE:") print(f" TITLE: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" YEARS: {sorted(set(early_years))}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet[:150]}...") # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is a new finding existing_titles = [p[&#x27;title'] "keyword">for p "keyword">in detailed_search['earliest_papers']] "keyword">if title "keyword">not "keyword">in existing_titles: detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers'].append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': link, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;years_found': sorted(set(early_years)), &#x27;search_query': query2, &#x27;confidence': 'high' "keyword">if any(domain "keyword">in link "keyword">for domain "keyword">in ['acm.org', 'ieee.org', 'researchgate.net']) "keyword">else 'medium' }) "keyword">elif has_pietro: print(f"\n{i}. {title[:50]}... (Pietro mentioned, no early years)") "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response2.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 2: {str(e)}") # Search Strategy 3: Look "keyword">for PhD thesis "keyword">or early academic work query3 = &#x27;"Pietro Murano" thesis dissertation PhD 2002 2003 2004 2005' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 3: {query3}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params3 = { "q": query3, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 8, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response3 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params3) "keyword">if response3.status_code == 200: results3 = response3.json() detailed_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query3, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results3.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response3.status_code} - Success") "keyword">if results3.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results3[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results3[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') link = result.get(&#x27;link', 'No URL') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i}. TITLE: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet[:100]}...") combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}" early_years = re.findall(r&#x27;\b(200[2-5])\b', combined_text) early_years = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in early_years] thesis_indicators = [&#x27;thesis', 'dissertation', 'phd', 'doctoral'] has_thesis_indicator = any(indicator "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in thesis_indicators) "keyword">if early_years "keyword">and has_thesis_indicator: print(f" üéì THESIS/DISSERTATION FOUND:") print(f" Years: {sorted(set(early_years))}") detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers'].append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': link, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;years_found': sorted(set(early_years)), &#x27;search_query': query3, &#x27;type': 'thesis', &#x27;confidence': 'high' }) "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response3.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 3: {str(e)}") print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;STEP 3: ANALYSIS OF EARLIEST PAPERS FOUND') print(&#x27;='*80) "keyword">if detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers']: print(f"Total early papers found: {len(detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers'])}") # Sort by earliest year sorted_papers = sorted(detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers'], key="keyword">lambda x: min(x.get(&#x27;years_found', [9999]))) print(&#x27;\nüìö CHRONOLOGICALLY SORTED EARLY PAPERS:') print(&#x27;-' * 60) "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(sorted_papers, 1): earliest_year = min(paper.get(&#x27;years_found', [])) print(f&#x27;\n{i}. YEAR: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27; TITLE: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {paper["url"]}') print(f&#x27; CONFIDENCE: {paper.get("confidence", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27; TYPE: {paper.get("type", "paper")}') print(f&#x27; YEARS FOUND: {paper["years_found"]}') print(f&#x27; SNIPPET: {paper["snippet"][:150]}...') print(f&#x27; SOURCE QUERY: {paper["search_query"][:50]}...') # Identify the earliest publication "keyword">if sorted_papers: earliest_paper = sorted_papers[0] earliest_year = min(earliest_paper.get(&#x27;years_found', [])) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ EARLIEST PUBLICATION IDENTIFIED:') print(f&#x27; YEAR: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27; TITLE: {earliest_paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {earliest_paper["url"]}') print(f&#x27; CONFIDENCE: {earliest_paper.get("confidence", "unknown")}') detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] = { &#x27;earliest_year': earliest_year, &#x27;title': earliest_paper['title'], &#x27;url': earliest_paper['url'], &#x27;confidence': earliest_paper.get('confidence', 'unknown'), &#x27;type': earliest_paper.get('type', 'paper') } "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No early papers found "keyword">in detailed search') print(&#x27;May need to examine the Google Scholar profile more closely') # Save detailed search results detailed_file = &#x27;workspace/pietro_murano_earliest_title_search.json' "keyword">with open(detailed_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(detailed_search, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ DETAILED SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {detailed_file}') print(f&#x27;üìà SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Targeted queries executed: {len(detailed_search["search_queries"])}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Early papers found: {len(detailed_search["earliest_papers"])}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {len([q "keyword">for q "keyword">in detailed_search["search_queries"] "keyword">if q["status"] == "success"])}') "keyword">if detailed_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): answer = detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ FINAL ANSWER:') print(f&#x27; Pietro Murano\'s earliest publication ({answer["earliest_year"]}): {answer["title"]}') print(f&#x27; Confidence: {answer["confidence"]}') print(f&#x27; Type: {answer["type"]}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Earliest publication title "keyword">not definitively identified') print(f&#x27; May require direct examination of Google Scholar profile "keyword">or CV') print(&#x27;\n=== EARLIEST PUBLICATION TITLE SEARCH COMPLETE ===')

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print(&#x27;=== FINAL PHASE: EXTRACTING COMPLETE TITLE OF PIETRO MURANO\'S EARLIEST PUBLICATION ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Get the complete, untruncated title of Pietro Murano\'s first authored paper') print(&#x27;Current finding: 2003 paper "keyword">with truncated title "Anthropomorphic vs. Non-anthropomorphic Software..."') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # First, inspect the detailed search results file detailed_file = &#x27;workspace/pietro_murano_earliest_title_search.json' "keyword">if os.path.exists(detailed_file): print(&#x27;STEP 1: INSPECTING DETAILED SEARCH RESULTS') print(&#x27;-' * 60) "keyword">with open(detailed_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: detailed_search = json.load(f) print(f&#x27;File structure: {list(detailed_search.keys())}') print(f&#x27;Earliest papers found: {len(detailed_search.get("earliest_papers", []))}') "keyword">if detailed_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): answer = detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] print(f&#x27;\nCurrent earliest publication:') print(f&#x27; Year: {answer.get("earliest_year")}') print(f&#x27; Title: {answer.get("title")}') print(f&#x27; URL: {answer.get("url")}') print(f&#x27; Confidence: {answer.get("confidence")}') # Examine all earliest papers "keyword">for complete information "keyword">if detailed_search.get(&#x27;earliest_papers'): print(f&#x27;\nAll early papers found:') "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(detailed_search[&#x27;earliest_papers'], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. Year: {min(paper.get("years_found", []))}') print(f&#x27; Title: {paper.get("title")}') print(f&#x27; URL: {paper.get("url")}') print(f&#x27; Snippet: {paper.get("snippet", "")[:100]}...') print() "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Detailed search results file "keyword">not found') detailed_search = {} print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;STEP 2: TARGETED SEARCH FOR COMPLETE PAPER TITLE') print(&#x27;='*80) # Get API key api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">is "keyword">None: print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key") "keyword">else: print("‚úì API key available") # Initialize final search results final_search = { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;objective': 'Extract complete title of Pietro Murano\'s earliest publication', &#x27;search_queries': [], &#x27;complete_titles': [], &#x27;final_answer': "keyword">None } # Search Strategy 1: Direct search "keyword">for the specific ResearchGate paper query1 = &#x27;"Anthropomorphic vs Non-anthropomorphic Software Interface Feedback" Pietro Murano 2003' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 1: {query1}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params1 = { "q": query1, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response1 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params1) "keyword">if response1.status_code == 200: results1 = response1.json() final_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query1, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results1.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response1.status_code} - Success") "keyword">if results1.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results1[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results1[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') link = result.get(&#x27;link', 'No URL') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i}. TITLE: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}") # Look "keyword">for the complete title "keyword">in the snippet "keyword">or title combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}" # Check "keyword">if this contains the full paper title "keyword">if &#x27;anthropomorphic' "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">and 'pietro murano' "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">and '2003' "keyword">in combined_text: print(f" üìÑ COMPLETE TITLE CANDIDATE:") # Try to extract the complete title "keyword">from the snippet "keyword">import re # Look "keyword">for title patterns "keyword">in the snippet title_patterns = [ r&#x27;Anthropomorphic [^.]*?[Ff]eedback[^.]*?[Ss]ystems?[^.]*?[Uu]sage', r&#x27;Anthropomorphic [^.]*?[Nn]on-anthropomorphic[^.]*?[Ff]eedback[^.]*', r&#x27;"([^"]*[Aa]nthropomorphic[^"]*)",?' ] extracted_title = "keyword">None "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: extracted_title = matches[0] print(f" Extracted title: {extracted_title}") "keyword">break final_search[&#x27;complete_titles'].append({ &#x27;source_title': title, &#x27;extracted_title': extracted_title, &#x27;full_snippet': snippet, &#x27;url': link, &#x27;year': 2003, &#x27;confidence': 'high' "keyword">if 'researchgate' "keyword">in link.lower() "keyword">else 'medium' }) "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response1.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 1: {str(e)}") # Search Strategy 2: Look "keyword">for the paper "keyword">in academic databases query2 = &#x27;site:researchgate.net "Pietro Murano" anthropomorphic interface feedback 2003' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 2: {query2}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params2 = { "q": query2, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 8, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response2 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params2) "keyword">if response2.status_code == 200: results2 = response2.json() final_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query2, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results2.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response2.status_code} - Success") "keyword">if results2.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results2[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results2[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') link = result.get(&#x27;link', 'No URL') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i}. üîç RESEARCHGATE RESULT:") print(f" TITLE: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}") "keyword">if &#x27;2003' "keyword">in f"{title} {snippet}" "keyword">and 'anthropomorphic' "keyword">in f"{title} {snippet}".lower(): print(f" üìÑ POTENTIAL COMPLETE TITLE SOURCE") final_search[&#x27;complete_titles'].append({ &#x27;source_title': title, &#x27;full_snippet': snippet, &#x27;url': link, &#x27;year': 2003, &#x27;confidence': 'high', &#x27;source_type': 'researchgate' }) "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response2.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 2: {str(e)}") # Search Strategy 3: Look "keyword">for any 2002 publications to confirm 2003 "keyword">is earliest query3 = &#x27;"Pietro Murano" 2002 publication paper journal conference' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 3: {query3}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params3 = { "q": query3, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 8, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response3 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params3) "keyword">if response3.status_code == 200: results3 = response3.json() final_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query3, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results3.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response3.status_code} - Success") found_2002 = "keyword">False "keyword">if results3.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results3[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results3[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') "keyword">if &#x27;2002' "keyword">in f"{title} {snippet}" "keyword">and 'pietro murano' "keyword">in f"{title} {snippet}".lower(): print(f"\n{i}. ‚ö†Ô∏è POTENTIAL 2002 PUBLICATION:") print(f" TITLE: {title}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}") found_2002 = "keyword">True "keyword">else: print(f"\n{i}. {title[:50]}... (No 2002 Pietro Murano match)") "keyword">if "keyword">not found_2002: print("\n‚úÖ No clear 2002 publications found - 2003 likely "keyword">is earliest") "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response3.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 3: {str(e)}") print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;STEP 3: FINAL ANALYSIS AND TITLE EXTRACTION') print(&#x27;='*80) # Analyze all findings to determine the complete title "keyword">if final_search.get(&#x27;complete_titles'): print(f"Total title candidates found: {len(final_search[&#x27;complete_titles'])}") # Look "keyword">for the most complete "keyword">and reliable title best_candidate = "keyword">None highest_confidence = 0 "keyword">for candidate "keyword">in final_search[&#x27;complete_titles']: confidence_score = 0 # Score based on confidence level "keyword">if candidate.get(&#x27;confidence') == 'high': confidence_score += 3 "keyword">elif candidate.get(&#x27;confidence') == 'medium': confidence_score += 2 # Score based on source type "keyword">if candidate.get(&#x27;source_type') == 'researchgate': confidence_score += 2 # Score based on title completeness title_text = candidate.get(&#x27;source_title', '') + ' ' + candidate.get('full_snippet', '') "keyword">if &#x27;anthropomorphic' "keyword">in title_text.lower() "keyword">and 'interface' "keyword">in title_text.lower(): confidence_score += 2 "keyword">if confidence_score > highest_confidence: highest_confidence = confidence_score best_candidate = candidate "keyword">if best_candidate: print(f"\nüèÜ BEST TITLE CANDIDATE (Score: {highest_confidence}):") print(f" Source Title: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;source_title')}") print(f" URL: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;url')}") print(f" Year: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;year')}") print(f" Confidence: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;confidence')}") print(f" Snippet: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;full_snippet', '')[:200]}...") # Try to extract the most complete title "keyword">from available information source_title = best_candidate.get(&#x27;source_title', '') snippet = best_candidate.get(&#x27;full_snippet', '') # Look "keyword">for the complete title "keyword">in the snippet complete_title = "keyword">None # Check "keyword">if the snippet contains a more complete title "keyword">if &#x27;Anthropomorphic' "keyword">in snippet "keyword">and 'Interface Feedback' "keyword">in snippet: # Extract title "keyword">from snippet patterns "keyword">import re # Pattern 1: Look "keyword">for title "keyword">in quotes "keyword">or at beginning of snippet title_match = re.search(r&#x27;(Anthropomorphic[^.]*?Interface Feedback[^.]*?Usage)', snippet) "keyword">if title_match: complete_title = title_match.group(1) "keyword">else: # Pattern 2: Look "keyword">for title "keyword">with "vs" "keyword">or "Vs" title_match = re.search(r&#x27;(Anthropomorphic[^.]*?vs[^.]*?Software[^.]*?)', snippet) "keyword">if title_match: complete_title = title_match.group(1) # If we couldn't extract "keyword">from snippet, use the source title "keyword">if "keyword">not complete_title: complete_title = source_title # Clean up the title "keyword">if complete_title: complete_title = complete_title.replace(&#x27;(PDF)', '').strip() complete_title = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', ' ', complete_title) # Remove extra spaces final_search[&#x27;final_answer'] = { &#x27;complete_title': complete_title, &#x27;year': best_candidate.get('year'), &#x27;url': best_candidate.get('url'), &#x27;confidence': best_candidate.get('confidence'), &#x27;source': 'comprehensive_search' } print(f"\nüéØ EXTRACTED COMPLETE TITLE:") print(f" {complete_title}") print(f" Year: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;year')}") print(f" Confidence: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;confidence')}") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå No complete title candidates found") # Fall back to the previous finding "keyword">if detailed_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): prev_answer = detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] final_search[&#x27;final_answer'] = { &#x27;complete_title': prev_answer.get('title', 'Anthropomorphic vs. Non-anthropomorphic Software Interface Feedback "keyword">for Online Systems Usage'), &#x27;year': prev_answer.get('earliest_year'), &#x27;url': prev_answer.get('url'), &#x27;confidence': 'medium', &#x27;source': 'previous_search' } print(f"\nüîÑ USING PREVIOUS FINDING:") print(f" Title: {final_search[&#x27;final_answer']['complete_title']}") print(f" Year: {final_search[&#x27;final_answer']['year']}") # Save final results final_file = &#x27;workspace/pietro_murano_earliest_publication_final.json' "keyword">with open(final_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_search, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ FINAL RESULTS SAVED TO: {final_file}') print(f&#x27;üìà FINAL SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Final queries executed: {len(final_search.get("search_queries", []))}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Title candidates found: {len(final_search.get("complete_titles", []))}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {len([q "keyword">for q "keyword">in final_search.get("search_queries", []) "keyword">if q.get("status") == "success"])}') "keyword">if final_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): answer = final_search[&#x27;final_answer'] print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ FINAL ANSWER - PIETRO MURANO\'S EARLIEST PUBLICATION:') print(f&#x27; Title: "{answer["complete_title"]}"') print(f&#x27; Year: {answer["year"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {answer["url"]}') print(f&#x27; Confidence: {answer["confidence"]}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Could "keyword">not definitively identify the complete title') print(&#x27;\n=== PIETRO MURANO EARLIEST PUBLICATION RESEARCH COMPLETE ===')

Year: {min(paper.get("years_found", []))}') print(f&#x27; Title: {paper.get("title")}') print(f&#x27; URL: {paper.get("url")}') print(f&#x27; Snippet: {paper.get("snippet", "")[:100]}...') print() "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Detailed search results file "keyword">not found') detailed_search = {} print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;STEP 2: TARGETED SEARCH FOR COMPLETE PAPER TITLE') print(&#x27;='*80) # Get API key api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">is "keyword">None: print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key") "keyword">else: print("‚úì API key available") # Initialize final search results final_search = { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;objective': 'Extract complete title of Pietro Murano\'s earliest publication', &#x27;search_queries': [], &#x27;complete_titles': [], &#x27;final_answer': "keyword">None } # Search Strategy 1: Direct search "keyword">for the specific ResearchGate paper query1 = &#x27;"Anthropomorphic vs Non-anthropomorphic Software Interface Feedback" Pietro Murano 2003' print(f&#x27;\nSEARCH 1: {query1}') print(&#x27;-' * 60) params1 = { "q": query1, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } "keyword">try: response1 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params1) "keyword">if response1.status_code == 200: results1 = response1.json() final_search[&#x27;search_queries'].append({ &#x27;query': query1, &#x27;status': 'success', &#x27;results_count': len(results1.get('organic_results', [])) }) print(f"Status: {response1.status_code} - Success") "keyword">if results1.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results1[&#x27;organic_results'])} results:") "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(results1[&#x27;organic_results'], 1): title = result.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') link = result.get(&#x27;link', 'No URL') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i}. TITLE: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}") # Look "keyword">for the complete title "keyword">in the snippet "keyword">or title combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}" # Check "keyword">if this contains the full paper title "keyword">if &#x27;anthropomorphic' "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">and 'pietro murano' "keyword">in combined_text.lower() "keyword">and '2003' "keyword">in combined_text: print(f" üìÑ COMPLETE TITLE CANDIDATE:") # Try to extract the complete title "keyword">from the snippet "keyword">import re # Look "keyword">for title patterns "keyword">in the snippet title_patterns = [ r&#x27;Anthropomorphic [^.]*?[Ff]eedback[^.]*?[Ss]ystems?[^.]*?[Uu]sage', r&#x27;Anthropomorphic [^.]*?[Nn]on-anthropomorphic[^.]*?[Ff]eedback[^.]*', r&#x27;"([^"]*[Aa]nthropomorphic[^"]*)",?' ] extracted_title = "keyword">None "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: extracted_title = matches[0] print(f" Extracted title: {extracted_title}") "keyword">break final_search[&#x27;complete_titles'].append({ &#x27;source_title': title, &#x27;extracted_title': extracted_title, &#x27;full_snippet': snippet, &#x27;url': link, &#x27;year': 2003, &#x27;confidence': 'high' "keyword">if 'researchgate' "keyword">in link.lower() "keyword">else 'medium' }) "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response1.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 1: {str(e)}") # (No 2002 Pietro Murano match)") "keyword">if "keyword">not found_2002: print("\n‚úÖ No clear 2002 publications found - 2003 likely "keyword">is earliest") "keyword">else: print("No organic results found") "keyword">else: print(f"Search failed "keyword">with status {response3.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error "keyword">in search 3: {str(e)}") print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;STEP 3: FINAL ANALYSIS AND TITLE EXTRACTION') print(&#x27;='*80) # Score based on confidence level "keyword">if candidate.get(&#x27;confidence') == 'high': confidence_score += 3 "keyword">elif candidate.get(&#x27;confidence') == 'medium': confidence_score += 2 # Score based on source type "keyword">if candidate.get(&#x27;source_type') == 'researchgate': confidence_score += 2 # Score based on title completeness title_text = candidate.get(&#x27;source_title', '') + ' ' + candidate.get('full_snippet', '') "keyword">if &#x27;anthropomorphic' "keyword">in title_text.lower() "keyword">and 'interface' "keyword">in title_text.lower(): confidence_score += 2 "keyword">if confidence_score > highest_confidence: highest_confidence = confidence_score best_candidate = candidate "keyword">if best_candidate: print(f"\nüèÜ BEST TITLE CANDIDATE (Score: {highest_confidence}):") print(f" Source Title: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;source_title')}") print(f" URL: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;url')}") print(f" Year: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;year')}") print(f" Confidence: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;confidence')}") print(f" Snippet: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;full_snippet', '')[:200]}...") # Try to extract the most complete title "keyword">from available information source_title = best_candidate.get(&#x27;source_title', '') snippet = best_candidate.get(&#x27;full_snippet', '') # Look "keyword">for the complete title "keyword">in the snippet complete_title = "keyword">None # Check "keyword">if the snippet contains a more complete title "keyword">if &#x27;Anthropomorphic' "keyword">in snippet "keyword">and 'Interface Feedback' "keyword">in snippet: # Extract title "keyword">from snippet patterns "keyword">import re # Pattern 1: Look "keyword">for title "keyword">in quotes "keyword">or at beginning of snippet title_match = re.search(r&#x27;(Anthropomorphic[^.]*?Interface Feedback[^.]*?Usage)', snippet) "keyword">if title_match: complete_title = title_match.group(1) "keyword">else: # Pattern 2: Look "keyword">for title "keyword">with "vs" "keyword">or "Vs" title_match = re.search(r&#x27;(Anthropomorphic[^.]*?vs[^.]*?Software[^.]*?)', snippet) "keyword">if title_match: complete_title = title_match.group(1) # If we couldn't extract "keyword">from snippet, use the source title "keyword">if "keyword">not complete_title: complete_title = source_title # Clean up the title "keyword">if complete_title: complete_title = complete_title.replace(&#x27;(PDF)', '').strip() complete_title = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', ' ', complete_title) # Remove extra spaces final_search[&#x27;final_answer'] = { &#x27;complete_title': complete_title, &#x27;year': best_candidate.get('year'), &#x27;url': best_candidate.get('url'), &#x27;confidence': best_candidate.get('confidence'), &#x27;source': 'comprehensive_search' } print(f"\nüéØ EXTRACTED COMPLETE TITLE:") print(f" {complete_title}") print(f" Year: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;year')}") print(f" Confidence: {best_candidate.get(&#x27;confidence')}") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå No complete title candidates found") # Fall back to the previous finding "keyword">if detailed_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): prev_answer = detailed_search[&#x27;final_answer'] final_search[&#x27;final_answer'] = { &#x27;complete_title': prev_answer.get('title', 'Anthropomorphic vs. Non-anthropomorphic Software Interface Feedback "keyword">for Online Systems Usage'), &#x27;year': prev_answer.get('earliest_year'), &#x27;url': prev_answer.get('url'), &#x27;confidence': 'medium', &#x27;source': 'previous_search' } print(f"\nüîÑ USING PREVIOUS FINDING:") print(f" Title: {final_search[&#x27;final_answer']['complete_title']}") print(f" Year: {final_search[&#x27;final_answer']['year']}") # Save final results final_file = &#x27;workspace/pietro_murano_earliest_publication_final.json' "keyword">with open(final_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_search, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ FINAL RESULTS SAVED TO: {final_file}') print(f&#x27;üìà FINAL SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Final queries executed: {len(final_search.get("search_queries", []))}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Title candidates found: {len(final_search.get("complete_titles", []))}') print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {len([q "keyword">for q "keyword">in final_search.get("search_queries", []) "keyword">if q.get("status") == "success"])}') "keyword">if final_search.get(&#x27;final_answer'): answer = final_search[&#x27;final_answer'] print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ FINAL ANSWER - PIETRO MURANO\'S EARLIEST PUBLICATION:') print(f&#x27; Title: "{answer["complete_title"]}"') print(f&#x27; Year: {answer["year"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {answer["url"]}') print(f&#x27; Confidence: {answer["confidence"]}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Could "keyword">not definitively identify the complete title') print(&#x27;\n=== PIETRO MURANO EARLIEST PUBLICATION RESEARCH COMPLETE ===')

"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint(\'=== SEARCHING FOR 2015 PAPER: PIE MENUS OR LINEAR MENUS, WHICH IS BETTER? ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Find the paper, identify all authors, and research their prior publications\')\nprint(\'Target format: First M. Last for author names\')\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80 + \'\\n\')\n\n# Get SerpAPI key from environment variables\napi_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")\n\nif api_key is None:\n print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.")\nelse:\n print("‚úì API key found, proceeding with search")\n\n# Initialize comprehensive search results storage\nsearch_results = {\n \'timestamp\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'target_paper\': \'Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?\',\n \'target_year\': 2015,\n \'search_queries\': [],\n \'paper_findings\': [],\n \'author_information\': [],\n \'next_steps\': []\n}\n\nprint(\'SEARCH STRATEGY:\')\nprint(\'1. Direct title search with year\')\nprint(\'2. Academic database searches (Google Scholar focus)\')\nprint(\'3. Publisher website searches\')\nprint(\'4. Alternative phrasings and variations\')\nprint()\n\n# Search Query 1: Direct title search with 2015\nquery1 = \'"Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?" 2015\'\nprint(f\'SEARCH 1: {query1}\')\nprint(\'-\' * 60)\n\nparams1 = {\n "q": query1,\n "api_key": api_key,\n "engine": "google",\n "google_domain": "google.com",\n "safe": "off",\n "num": 15,\n "type": "search"\n}\n\nresponse1 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params1)\n\nif response1.status_code == 200:\n results1 = response1.json()\n search_results[\'search_queries\'].append({\n \'query\': query1,\n \'status\': \'success\',\n \'results_count\': len(results1.get(\'organic_results\', []))\n })\n \n print(f"Status: {response1.status_code} - Success")\n \n if results1.get("organic_results"):\n print(f"Found {len(results1[\'organic_results\'])} results:")\n print()\n \n for i, result in enumerate(results1[\'organic_results\'], 1):\n title = result.get(\'title\', \'No title\')\n link = result.get(\'link\', \'No URL\')\n snippet = result.get(\'snippet\', \'No snippet\')\n \n print(f"{i}. TITLE: {title}")\n print(f" URL: {link}")\n print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}")\n \n # Check for high relevance indicators\n title_lower = title.lower()\n snippet_lower = snippet.lower()\n combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}"\n \n relevance_indicators = []\n if \'pie menu\' in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(\'pie_menu\')\n if \'linear menu\' in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(\'linear_menu\')\n if \'2015\' in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(\'2015\')\n if any(term in combined_text for term in [\'author\', \'paper\', \'research\', \'study\']):\n relevance_indicators.append(\'academic\')\n if any(term in combined_text for term in [\'acm\', \'ieee\', \'chi\', \'uist\', \'hci\']):\n relevance_indicators.append(\'conference\')\n \n relevance_score = len(relevance_indicators)\n \n if relevance_score >= 3:\n print(f" ‚≠ê HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}) - Indicators: {\', \'.join(relevance_indicators)}")\n \n # Store high-relevance findings\n search_results[\'paper_findings\'].append({\n \'search_query\': query1,\n \'title\': title,\n \'url\': link,\n \'snippet\': snippet,\n \'relevance_score\': relevance_score,\n \'relevance_indicators\': relevance_indicators,\n \'rank\': i\n })\n elif relevance_score >= 1:\n print(f" ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (Score: {relevance_score}) - {\', \'.join(relevance_indicators)}")\n \n print()\n else:\n print("No organic results found for direct search")\nelse:\n print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response1.status_code}: {response1.text}")\n search_results[\'search_queries\'].append({\n \'query\': query1,\n \'status\': \'failed\',\n \'error\': f"Status {response1.status_code}"\n })\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'SEARCH 2: Academic-focused search\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# Search Query 2: Academic database focus\nquery2 = \'pie menus linear menus comparison 2015 HCI user interface\'\nprint(f\'QUERY: {query2}\')\nprint(\'-\' * 60)\n\nparams2 = {\n "q": query2,\n "api_key": api_key,\n "engine": "google",\n "google_domain": "google.com",\n "safe": "off",\n "num": 15,\n "type": "search"\n}\n\nresponse2 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params2)\n\nif response2.status_code == 200:\n results2 = response2.json()\n search_results[\'search_queries\'].append({\n \'query\': query2,\n \'status\': \'success\',\n \'results_count\': len(results2.get(\'organic_results\', []))\n })\n \n print(f"Status: {response2.status_code} - Success")\n \n if results2.get("organic_results"):\n print(f"Found {len(results2[\'organic_results\'])} results:")\n print()\n \n for i, result in enumerate(results2[\'organic_results\'], 1):\n title = result.get(\'title\', \'No title\')\n link = result.get(\'link\', \'No URL\')\n snippet = result.get(\'snippet\', \'No snippet\')\n \n # Check for the specific paper\n combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}"\n \n # Look for exact or near-exact matches\n exact_match_indicators = [\n \'pie menus or linear menus\' in combined_text,\n \'which is better\' in combined_text,\n \'2015\' in combined_text\n ]\n \n if sum(exact_match_indicators) >= 2:\n print(f"{i}. üéØ POTENTIAL EXACT MATCH:")\n print(f" TITLE: {title}")\n print(f" URL: {link}")\n print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}")\n print(f" Match indicators: {sum(exact_match_indicators)}/3")\n \n search_results[\'paper_findings\'].append({\n \'search_query\': query2,\n \'title\': title,\n \'url\': link,\n \'snippet\': snippet,\n \'relevance_score\': 10, # Highest score for potential exact match\n \'match_type\': \'potential_exact\',\n \'rank\': i\n })\n \n elif any(term in combined_text for term in [\'pie menu\', \'linear menu\']) and \'2015\' in combined_text:\n print(f"{i}. üìã RELATED PAPER:")\n print(f" TITLE: {title}")\n print(f" URL: {link}")\n print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}")\n \n search_results[\'paper_findings\'].append({\n \'search_query\': query2,\n \'title\': title,\n \'url\': link,\n \'snippet\': snippet,\n \'relevance_score\': 7,\n \'match_type\': \'related\',\n \'rank\': i\n })\n \n print()\n else:\n print("No organic results found for academic search")\nelse:\n print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response2.status_code}: {response2.text}")\n search_results[\'search_queries\'].append({\n \'query\': query2,\n \'status\': \'failed\',\n \'error\': f"Status {response2.status_code}"\n })\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'SEARCH 3: Conference and publisher specific search\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# Search Query 3: Conference/publisher specific\nquery3 = \'site:acm.org OR site:ieee.org "pie menus" "linear menus" 2015\'\nprint(f\'QUERY: {query3}\')\nprint(\'-\' * 60)\n\nparams3 = {\n "q": query3,\n "api_key": api_key,\n "engine": "google",\n "google_domain": "google.com",\n "safe": "off",\n "num": 10,\n "type": "search"\n}\n\nresponse3 = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params3)\n\nif response3.status_code == 200:\n results3 = response3.json()\n search_results[\'search_queries\'].append({\n \'query\': query3,\n \'status\': \'success\',\n \'results_count\': len(results3.get(\'organic_results\', []))\n })\n \n print(f"Status: {response3.status_code} - Success")\n \n if results3.get("organic_results"):\n print(f"Found {len(results3[\'organic_results\'])} results from ACM/IEEE:")\n print()\n \n for i, result in enumerate(results3[\'organic_results\'], 1):\n title = result.get(\'title\', \'No title\')\n link = result.get(\'link\', \'No URL\')\n snippet = result.get(\'snippet\', \'No snippet\')\n \n print(f"{i}. TITLE: {title}")\n print(f" URL: {link}")\n print(f" SNIPPET: {snippet}")\n \n # All results from ACM/IEEE are considered high quality\n search_results[\'paper_findings\'].append({\n \'search_query\': query3,\n \'title\': title,\n \'url\': link,\n \'snippet\': snippet,\n \'relevance_score\': 8, # High score for academic sources\n \'match_type\': \'academic_source\',\n \'rank\': i\n })\n print()\n else:\n print("No results found from ACM/IEEE databases")\nelse:\n print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response3.status_code}: {response3.text}")\n search_results[\'search_queries\'].append({\n \'query\': query3,\n \'status\': \'failed\',\n \'error\': f"Status {response3.status_code}"\n })\n\n# Analyze all findings\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF SEARCH RESULTS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\ntotal_findings = len(search_results[\'paper_findings\'])\nprint(f\'Total paper findings: {total_findings}\')\nprint(f\'Search queries executed: {len(search_results["search_queries"])}\')\nprint()\n\nif search_results[\'paper_findings\']:\n # Sort findings by relevance score\n sorted_findings = sorted(search_results[\'paper_findings\'], key=lambda x: x[\'relevance_score\'], reverse=True)\n \n print(\'üèÜ TOP FINDINGS (by relevance score):\')\n print(\'-\' * 60)\n \n for i, finding in enumerate(sorted_findings[:5], 1):\n print(f\'{i}. SCORE: {finding["relevance_score"]} | TYPE: {finding.get("match_type", "standard")}\')\n print(f\' TITLE: {finding["title"]}\')\n print(f\' URL: {finding["url"]}\')\n print(f\' FROM: {finding["search_query"]}\')\n print()\n \n # Identify the most promising candidates\n exact_matches = [f for f in sorted_findings if f.get(\'match_type\') == \'potential_exact\']\n academic_sources = [f for f in sorted_findings if f.get(\'match_type\') == \'academic_source\']\n \n print(f\'üìä FINDING CATEGORIES:\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Potential exact matches: {len(exact_matches)}\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Academic source results: {len(academic_sources)}\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Other relevant results: {total_findings - len(exact_matches) - len(academic_sources)}\')\n \n # Set next steps based on findings\n if exact_matches:\n search_results[\'next_steps\'].append(\'Investigate potential exact matches for author information\')\n print(\'\\n‚úÖ NEXT STEP: Investigate potential exact matches for author details\')\n \n if academic_sources:\n search_results[\'next_steps\'].append(\'Check academic database results for the target paper\')\n print(\'‚úÖ NEXT STEP: Examine academic database results\')\n \n search_results[\'next_steps\'].append(\'Parse paper URLs to extract author information\')\n search_results[\'next_steps\'].append(\'Research each identified author for pre-2015 publications\')\n \nelse:\n print(\'‚ùå No relevant findings from any search query\')\n search_results[\'next_steps\'].append(\'Try alternative search strategies\')\n search_results[\'next_steps\'].append(\'Search with different paper title variations\')\n\n# Save comprehensive search results\nresults_file = \'workspace/pie_menus_paper_search_results.json\'\nwith open(results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f\'\\nüíæ SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}\')\nprint(f\'üìà SEARCH STATISTICS:\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Queries executed: {len(search_results["search_queries"])}\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Total findings: {total_findings}\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {len([q for q in search_results["search_queries"] if q["status"] == "success"])}\')\n\nif search_results[\'paper_findings\']:\n highest_score = max(f[\'relevance_score\'] for f in search_results[\'paper_findings\'])\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Highest relevance score: {highest_score}\')\n print(\'\\nüéØ READY FOR NEXT PHASE: Author identification and research\')\nelse:\n print(\'\\n‚ö†Ô∏è May need additional search strategies to locate the paper\')\n\nprint(\'\\n=== INITIAL SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===\')',

"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint(\'=== PHASE 2: AUTHOR EXTRACTION AND PUBLICATION HISTORY RESEARCH ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Extract complete author list in "First M. Last" format\')\nprint(\'Then research each author\\\'s pre-2015 publications\')\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80 + \'\\n\')\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the search results file structure\nresults_file = \'workspace/pie_menus_paper_search_results.json\'\n\nif os.path.exists(results_file):\n print(\'‚úì Found search results file, inspecting structure...\')\n \n # Read and inspect the file structure first\n with open(results_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n search_data = json.load(f)\n \n print(\'FILE STRUCTURE INSPECTION:\')\n print(f\'- File type: {type(search_data)}\')\n print(f\'- Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys()) if isinstance(search_data, dict) else "Not a dict"}\')\n \n if isinstance(search_data, dict):\n for key, value in search_data.items():\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f\'- {key}: list with {len(value)} items\')\n if len(value) > 0:\n print(f\' First item type: {type(value[0])}\')\n if isinstance(value[0], dict):\n print(f\' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}\')\n else:\n print(f\'- {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:100]}...\')\nelse:\n print(\'‚ùå Search results file not found\')\n exit()\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM SEARCH RESULTS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# Extract author information from the search results\nauthor_info = {\n \'paper_title\': \'Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?\',\n \'publication_year\': 2015,\n \'authors_identified\': [],\n \'author_details\': {},\n \'publication_sources\': []\n}\n\n# Look through the paper findings for author information\nif \'paper_findings\' in search_data:\n print(f\'Analyzing {len(search_data["paper_findings"])} paper findings for author information...\')\n \n # Focus on the highest relevance findings first\n sorted_findings = sorted(search_data[\'paper_findings\'], key=lambda x: x.get(\'relevance_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n print(\'\\nTOP 5 MOST RELEVANT FINDINGS:\')\n for i, finding in enumerate(sorted_findings[:5], 1):\n title = finding.get(\'title\', \'No title\')\n url = finding.get(\'url\', \'No URL\')\n snippet = finding.get(\'snippet\', \'No snippet\')\n score = finding.get(\'relevance_score\', 0)\n \n print(f\'\\n{i}. SCORE: {score}\')\n print(f\' TITLE: {title}\')\n print(f\' URL: {url}\')\n print(f\' SNIPPET: {snippet[:200]}...\')\n \n # Extract author information from snippets and titles\n combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower()\n \n # Look for author names in the text\n if \'pietro murano\' in combined_text:\n if \'Pietro Murano\' not in author_info[\'authors_identified\']:\n author_info[\'authors_identified\'].append(\'Pietro Murano\')\n print(\' üìù AUTHOR FOUND: Pietro Murano\')\n \n if \'iram n. khan\' in combined_text or \'iram khan\' in combined_text:\n if \'Iram N. Khan\' not in author_info[\'authors_identified\']:\n author_info[\'authors_identified\'].append(\'Iram N. Khan\')\n print(\' üìù AUTHOR FOUND: Iram N. Khan\')\n \n # Store publication source information\n if score >= 8: # High relevance sources\n source_info = {\n \'url\': url,\n \'title\': title,\n \'snippet\': snippet,\n \'relevance_score\': score\n }\n author_info[\'publication_sources\'].append(source_info)\n\nprint(f\'\\nüìã AUTHORS IDENTIFIED: {len(author_info["authors_identified"])}\')\nfor i, author in enumerate(author_info[\'authors_identified\'], 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author}\')\n\n# Format authors in the required "First M. Last" format\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*60)\nprint(\'FORMATTING AUTHORS IN REQUIRED FORMAT\')\nprint(\'=\'*60)\n\nformatted_authors = []\nfor author in author_info[\'authors_identified\']:\n # Pietro Murano -> Pietro Murano (already in correct format)\n # Iram N. Khan -> Iram N. Khan (already in correct format)\n formatted_authors.append(author)\n print(f\'‚úì {author} -> {author} (correct format)\')\n\nauthor_info[\'formatted_authors\'] = formatted_authors\n\nprint(f\'\\nüéØ COMPLETE AUTHOR LIST IN "First M. Last" FORMAT:\')\nfor i, author in enumerate(formatted_authors, 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author}\')\n\n# Now research each author\'s publication history\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'RESEARCHING EACH AUTHOR\\\'S PRE-2015 PUBLICATION HISTORY\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# We\'ll need to search for each author\'s publications before 2015\nimport requests\n\napi_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")\nif api_key is None:\n print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key for publication research")\nelse:\n print("‚úì API key available for publication research")\n \n for author in formatted_authors:\n print(f\'\\n--- RESEARCHING: {author} ---\')\n print(\'-\' * 50)\n \n # Search for the author\'s publications before 2015\n search_queries = [\n f\'"{author}" publications before:2015\',\n f\'"{author}" papers research before:2015\',\n f\'site:scholar.google.com "{author}" before:2015\'\n ]\n \n author_publications = []\n \n for query in search_queries:\n print(f\'\\nSearching: {query}\')\n \n params = {\n "q": query,\n "api_key": api_key,\n "engine": "google",\n "google_domain": "google.com",\n "safe": "off",\n "num": 10,\n "type": "search"\n }\n \n try:\n response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n results = response.json()\n \n if results.get("organic_results"):\n print(f\' Found {len(results["organic_results"])} results\')\n \n for result in results["organic_results"][:5]: # Top 5 results\n title = result.get(\'title\', \'\')\n snippet = result.get(\'snippet\', \'\')\n url = result.get(\'link\', \'\')\n \n # Look for publication years before 2015\n combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}"\n \n # Extract years from the text\n import re\n years = re.findall(r\'\\b(19|20)\\d{2}\\b\', combined_text)\n pre_2015_years = [int(year) for year in years if int(year) < 2015 and int(year) > 1990]\n \n if pre_2015_years:\n publication_info = {\n \'title\': title,\n \'url\': url,\n \'snippet\': snippet,\n \'years_found\': pre_2015_years,\n \'search_query\': query\n }\n author_publications.append(publication_info)\n \n print(f\' üìÑ FOUND PRE-2015 PUBLICATION:\')\n print(f\' Title: {title[:80]}...\')\n print(f\' Years: {pre_2015_years}\')\n print(f\' URL: {url}\')\n else:\n print(\' No organic results found\')\n else:\n print(f\' Search failed with status {response.status_code}\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' Error: {str(e)}\')\n \n # Store the author\'s publication information\n author_info[\'author_details\'][author] = {\n \'pre_2015_publications\': author_publications,\n \'has_prior_publications\': len(author_publications) > 0,\n \'earliest_year_found\': min([min(pub[\'years_found\']) for pub in author_publications]) if author_publications else None\n }\n \n print(f\'\\nüìä SUMMARY FOR {author}:\')\n print(f\' Pre-2015 publications found: {len(author_publications)}\')\n if author_publications:\n earliest = author_info[\'author_details\'][author][\'earliest_year_found\']\n print(f\' Earliest publication year: {earliest}\')\n print(f\' ‚úÖ HAS PRIOR PUBLICATIONS BEFORE 2015\')\n else:\n print(f\' ‚ùå NO CLEAR PRE-2015 PUBLICATIONS FOUND\')\n\n# Final analysis and summary\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'FINAL ANALYSIS: AUTHORS WITH PRE-2015 PUBLICATIONS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\nauthors_with_prior_pubs = []\nfor author, details in author_info[\'author_details\'].items():\n if details[\'has_prior_publications\']:\n authors_with_prior_pubs.append({\n \'name\': author,\n \'earliest_year\': details[\'earliest_year_found\'],\n \'publication_count\': len(details[\'pre_2015_publications\'])\n })\n\nprint(f\'\\nüéØ COMPLETE AUTHOR LIST FOR "Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?" (2015):\')\nfor i, author in enumerate(formatted_authors, 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author}\')\n\nprint(f\'\\nüìö AUTHORS WITH PRE-2015 PUBLICATIONS:\')\nif authors_with_prior_pubs:\n for i, author_data in enumerate(authors_with_prior_pubs, 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author_data["name"]}\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Earliest publication: {author_data["earliest_year"]}\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Pre-2015 publications found: {author_data["publication_count"]}\')\nelse:\n print(\' ‚ùå No authors with clearly identified pre-2015 publications\')\n\n# Save comprehensive results\nfinal_results = {\n \'analysis_timestamp\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'paper_information\': {\n \'title\': \'Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?\',\n \'year\': 2015,\n \'journal\': \'Journal of Emerging Trends in Computing and Information Sciences\',\n \'volume\': \'6\',\n \'issue\': \'9\'\n },\n \'complete_author_list\': formatted_authors,\n \'author_research_results\': author_info[\'author_details\'],\n \'authors_with_prior_publications\': authors_with_prior_pubs,\n \'summary\': {\n \'total_authors\': len(formatted_authors),\n \'authors_with_pre_2015_pubs\': len(authors_with_prior_pubs)\n }\n}\n\nresults_file = \'workspace/pie_menus_authors_analysis.json\'\nwith open(results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f\'\\nüíæ COMPLETE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}\')\nprint(\'\\n=== AUTHOR RESEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===\')',
"description": "This code implements Phase 2 of the paper analysis task. I'm first inspecting the structure of the search results JSON file to understand its format, then extracting the complete author list from the identified paper 'Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?' (2015). From the search results, I can identify the authors as Pietro Murano and Iram N. Khan, which are already in the required 'First M. Last' format. The code then systematically researches each author's publication history before 2015 using multiple search strategies: (1) Direct author name searches with 'before:2015' qualifier, (2) Academic paper searches, and (3) Google Scholar specific searches. For each author, I'm extracting publication information, identifying years mentioned in titles and snippets, and filtering for pre-2015 publications. The code analyzes which authors had prior publications before the 2015 target paper and saves comprehensive results including the complete author list, individual publication histories, and a summary of findings to workspace/pie_menus_authors_analysis.json.",

Khan' and 'Authors: Pietro Murano' but weren't captured. **PLAN** alignment: 25% complete - paper sources identified but author extraction failed, resulting in empty author list and no publication history research. Critical issue: The author extraction approach was too restrictive, requiring exact lowercase matches instead of parsing the rich author data available in the search results. Recommended fix: Implement more robust author name extraction using regex patterns to find 'Author:', 'by', publication citations, and name patterns in the high-relevance snippets and titles, then proceed with the publication history research for the identified authors.",

"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nimport re\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint(\'=== PHASE 2 REVISED: ROBUST AUTHOR EXTRACTION AND PUBLICATION RESEARCH ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Extract complete author list using improved parsing techniques\')\nprint(\'Then research each author\\\'s pre-2015 publications\')\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80 + \'\\n\')\n\n# Load and inspect the search results file structure first\nresults_file = \'workspace/pie_menus_paper_search_results.json\'\n\nif not os.path.exists(results_file):\n print(\'‚ùå Search results file not found\')\n exit()\n\nprint(\'STEP 1: LOADING AND INSPECTING SEARCH RESULTS FILE\')\nprint(\'-\' * 60)\n\nwith open(results_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n search_data = json.load(f)\n\nprint(f\'‚úì Loaded search data with {len(search_data.get("paper_findings", []))} paper findings\')\n\n# Inspect the structure of paper findings to understand available data\nif search_data.get(\'paper_findings\'):\n sample_finding = search_data[\'paper_findings\'][0]\n print(f\'\\nSample finding structure:\')\n for key, value in sample_finding.items():\n print(f\' {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:100]}...\')\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'STEP 2: ADVANCED AUTHOR EXTRACTION FROM SEARCH RESULTS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# Initialize comprehensive author extraction\nauthor_extraction_results = {\n \'paper_title\': \'Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?\',\n \'publication_year\': 2015,\n \'extraction_methods\': [],\n \'raw_author_mentions\': [],\n \'identified_authors\': [],\n \'high_confidence_sources\': []\n}\n\n# Define comprehensive author extraction patterns\nauthor_patterns = [\n r\'Authors?:\\s*([^\\n\\.]+)\', # "Authors: Pietro Murano, Iram Khan"\n r\'by\\s+([A-Z][a-z]+\\s+[A-Z][^\\n\\.]{0,50})\', # "by Pietro Murano"\n r\'([A-Z][a-z]+\\s+[A-Z][a-z]*\\.?\\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)(?:\\s*,\\s*([A-Z][a-z]+\\s+[A-Z][a-z]*\\.?\\s+[A-Z][a-z]+))?\', # Name patterns\n r\'Murano[,\\s]+P[^\\n]*Khan[,\\s]+I[^\\n]*\', # Citation format\n r\'Pietro\\s+Murano[^\\n]*Iram[^\\n]*Khan\', # Direct name mentions\n r\'P\\.?\\s*Murano[^\\n]*I\\.?\\s*N?\\.?\\s*Khan\' # Abbreviated formats\n]\n\nprint(\'ANALYZING HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS FOR AUTHOR INFORMATION:\')\nprint(\'-\' * 60)\n\n# Sort findings by relevance score\nsorted_findings = sorted(search_data[\'paper_findings\'], key=lambda x: x.get(\'relevance_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n\n# Focus on the top findings for author extraction\nfor i, finding in enumerate(sorted_findings[:10], 1):\n title = finding.get(\'title\', \'\')\n snippet = finding.get(\'snippet\', \'\')\n url = finding.get(\'url\', \'\')\n score = finding.get(\'relevance_score\', 0)\n \n print(f\'\\n{i}. ANALYZING FINDING (Score: {score}):\')\n print(f\' Title: {title[:80]}...\')\n print(f\' URL: {url}\')\n print(f\' Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...\')\n \n # Combine title and snippet for analysis\n combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}"\n \n # Apply all author extraction patterns\n authors_found_this_source = set()\n \n for pattern_idx, pattern in enumerate(author_patterns, 1):\n matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n \n if matches:\n print(f\' üìù Pattern {pattern_idx} matches: {matches}\')\n \n for match in matches:\n if isinstance(match, tuple):\n # Handle tuple matches (multiple groups)\n for name in match:\n if name and len(name.strip()) > 3:\n clean_name = name.strip()\n authors_found_this_source.add(clean_name)\n author_extraction_results[\'raw_author_mentions\'].append({\n \'name\': clean_name,\n \'source_url\': url,\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'context\': combined_text[:200]\n })\n else:\n # Handle string matches\n if len(match.strip()) > 3:\n clean_name = match.strip()\n authors_found_this_source.add(clean_name)\n author_extraction_results[\'raw_author_mentions\'].append({\n \'name\': clean_name,\n \'source_url\': url,\n \'pattern\': pattern,\n \'context\': combined_text[:200]\n })\n \n # Manual extraction for known author names in this specific case\n text_lower = combined_text.lower()\n \n # Look for Pietro Murano variations\n if any(variant in text_lower for variant in [\'pietro murano\', \'p. murano\', \'p murano\']):\n authors_found_this_source.add(\'Pietro Murano\')\n print(\' üìù Manual extraction: Pietro Murano\')\n \n # Look for Iram Khan variations \n if any(variant in text_lower for variant in [\'iram n. khan\', \'iram khan\', \'i. n. khan\', \'i n khan\']):\n authors_found_this_source.add(\'Iram N. Khan\')\n print(\' üìù Manual extraction: Iram N. Khan\')\n \n if authors_found_this_source:\n print(f\' ‚úÖ Authors found in this source: {list(authors_found_this_source)}\')\n \n # Store high-confidence source if score >= 8\n if score >= 8:\n author_extraction_results[\'high_confidence_sources\'].append({\n \'url\': url,\n \'title\': title,\n \'authors_found\': list(authors_found_this_source),\n \'relevance_score\': score\n })\n else:\n print(\' ‚ùå No authors extracted from this source\')\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*60)\nprint(\'STEP 3: CONSOLIDATING AND VALIDATING AUTHOR NAMES\')\nprint(\'=\'*60)\n\n# Consolidate all author mentions\nall_author_mentions = [mention[\'name\'] for mention in author_extraction_results[\'raw_author_mentions\']]\nprint(f\'\\nTotal raw author mentions: {len(all_author_mentions)}\')\nprint(f\'Unique mentions: {set(all_author_mentions)}\')\n\n# Manual validation and standardization for this specific paper\n# Based on the search results, we know the authors are Pietro Murano and Iram N. Khan\nvalidated_authors = []\n\n# Check for Pietro Murano variations\npietro_variations = [\'pietro murano\', \'p. murano\', \'p murano\', \'murano p\', \'murano, p\']\nhas_pietro = any(any(var in mention.lower() for var in pietro_variations) for mention in all_author_mentions)\n\nif has_pietro:\n validated_authors.append(\'Pietro Murano\')\n print(\'‚úÖ Confirmed author: Pietro Murano\')\n\n# Check for Iram Khan variations\niram_variations = [\'iram n. khan\', \'iram khan\', \'i. n. khan\', \'i n khan\', \'khan i\', \'khan, i\']\nhas_iram = any(any(var in mention.lower() for var in iram_variations) for mention in all_author_mentions)\n\nif has_iram:\n validated_authors.append(\'Iram N. Khan\')\n print(\'‚úÖ Confirmed author: Iram N. Khan\')\n\n# Additional validation from high-confidence sources\nfor source in author_extraction_results[\'high_confidence_sources\']:\n print(f\'\\nHigh-confidence source validation:\')\n print(f\' URL: {source["url"]}\')\n print(f\' Authors found: {source["authors_found"]}\')\n print(f\' Score: {source["relevance_score"]}\')\n\nauthor_extraction_results[\'identified_authors\'] = validated_authors\n\nprint(f\'\\nüéØ FINAL VALIDATED AUTHORS ({len(validated_authors)}):\')\nfor i, author in enumerate(validated_authors, 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author}\')\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'STEP 4: RESEARCHING EACH AUTHOR\\\'S PRE-2015 PUBLICATION HISTORY\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# Research each author\'s publications before 2015\nimport requests\n\napi_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")\nif api_key is None:\n print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key for publication research")\nelse:\n print("‚úì API key available for publication research")\n \n author_publication_data = {}\n \n for author in validated_authors:\n print(f\'\\n--- RESEARCHING: {author} ---\')\n print(\'-\' * 50)\n \n # Multiple search strategies for each author\n search_strategies = [\n f\'"{author}" publications before:2015 -2015\',\n f\'"{author}" papers research 2014 2013 2012 2011 2010\',\n f\'site:scholar.google.com "{author}" before:2015\',\n f\'"{author}" author academic papers -"2015"\'\n ]\n \n author_pubs = []\n \n for strategy_idx, query in enumerate(search_strategies, 1):\n print(f\'\\nStrategy {strategy_idx}: {query}\')\n \n params = {\n "q": query,\n "api_key": api_key,\n "engine": "google",\n "google_domain": "google.com",\n "safe": "off",\n "num": 10,\n "type": "search"\n }\n \n try:\n response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n results = response.json()\n \n if results.get("organic_results"):\n print(f\' Found {len(results["organic_results"])} results\')\n \n for result in results["organic_results"][:5]: # Top 5 results\n title = result.get(\'title\', \'\')\n snippet = result.get(\'snippet\', \'\')\n url = result.get(\'link\', \'\')\n \n combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}"\n \n # Extract years from the text (more comprehensive)\n year_patterns = [\n r\'\\b(19[9-9][0-9]|20[0-1][0-4])\\b\', # 1990-2014\n r\'\\((19[9-9][0-9]|20[0-1][0-4])\\)\', # (2010)\n r\',(19[9-9][0-9]|20[0-1][0-4])\', # ,2012\n ]\n \n all_years = set()\n for pattern in year_patterns:\n years = re.findall(pattern, combined_text)\n all_years.update([int(year) for year in years])\n \n pre_2015_years = [year for year in all_years if year < 2015 and year > 1990]\n \n # Check if this result is actually about the target author\n author_mentioned = author.lower() in combined_text.lower()\n \n if pre_2015_years and author_mentioned:\n publication_info = {\n \'title\': title,\n \'url\': url,\n \'snippet\': snippet[:300],\n \'years_found\': sorted(pre_2015_years),\n \'search_strategy\': query,\n \'confidence\': \'medium\'\n }\n \n # Increase confidence for academic sources\n if any(domain in url.lower() for domain in [\'scholar.google\', \'researchgate\', \'acm.org\', \'ieee.org\']):\n publication_info[\'confidence\'] = \'high\'\n \n author_pubs.append(publication_info)\n \n print(f\' üìÑ PRE-2015 PUBLICATION FOUND:\')\n print(f\' Title: {title[:60]}...\')\n print(f\' Years: {sorted(pre_2015_years)}\')\n print(f\' Confidence: {publication_info["confidence"]}\')\n print(f\' URL: {url}\')\n else:\n print(\' No organic results found\')\n else:\n print(f\' Search failed with status {response.status_code}\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' Error: {str(e)}\')\n \n # Analyze and store author\'s publication data\n unique_pubs = []\n seen_titles = set()\n \n for pub in author_pubs:\n title_key = pub[\'title\'].lower()[:50] # Use first 50 chars as key\n if title_key not in seen_titles:\n unique_pubs.append(pub)\n seen_titles.add(title_key)\n \n author_publication_data[author] = {\n \'total_publications_found\': len(unique_pubs),\n \'has_prior_publications\': len(unique_pubs) > 0,\n \'publications\': unique_pubs,\n \'earliest_year\': min([min(pub[\'years_found\']) for pub in unique_pubs]) if unique_pubs else None,\n \'high_confidence_pubs\': len([pub for pub in unique_pubs if pub[\'confidence\'] == \'high\'])\n }\n \n print(f\'\\nüìä RESEARCH SUMMARY FOR {author}:\')\n print(f\' Total unique pre-2015 publications found: {len(unique_pubs)}\')\n print(f\' High confidence publications: {author_publication_data[author]["high_confidence_pubs"]}\')\n if unique_pubs:\n earliest = author_publication_data[author][\'earliest_year\']\n print(f\' Earliest publication year found: {earliest}\')\n print(f\' ‚úÖ HAS PUBLICATIONS BEFORE 2015\')\n else:\n print(f\' ‚ùå NO PRE-2015 PUBLICATIONS CLEARLY IDENTIFIED\')\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'FINAL COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\n\n# Compile final results\nfinal_analysis = {\n \'analysis_timestamp\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'paper_information\': {\n \'title\': \'Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?\',\n \'year\': 2015,\n \'journal\': \'Journal of Emerging Trends in Computing and Information Sciences\',\n \'volume\': \'6\',\n \'issue\': \'9\',\n \'pages\': \'476-481\'\n },\n \'complete_author_list\': validated_authors,\n \'author_research_results\': author_publication_data,\n \'summary\': {\n \'total_authors\': len(validated_authors),\n \'authors_with_pre_2015_publications\': len([a for a, data in author_publication_data.items() if data[\'has_prior_publications\']]),\n \'extraction_success\': len(validated_authors) > 0\n }\n}\n\nprint(f\'\\nüéØ COMPLETE AUTHOR LIST FOR "Pie Menus or Linear Menus, Which Is Better?" (2015):\')\nfor i, author in enumerate(validated_authors, 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author}\')\n\nprint(f\'\\nüìö AUTHORS WITH PRE-2015 PUBLICATIONS:\')\nauthors_with_pubs = []\nfor author, data in author_publication_data.items():\n if data[\'has_prior_publications\']:\n authors_with_pubs.append({\n \'name\': author,\n \'publication_count\': data[\'total_publications_found\'],\n \'earliest_year\': data[\'earliest_year\'],\n \'high_confidence_count\': data[\'high_confidence_pubs\']\n })\n print(f\' ‚úÖ {author}:\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Publications found: {data["total_publications_found"]}\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ High confidence: {data["high_confidence_pubs"]}\')\n print(f\' ‚Ä¢ Earliest year: {data["earliest_year"]}\')\n\nif not authors_with_pubs:\n print(\' ‚ö†Ô∏è No authors with clearly identified pre-2015 publications in current search\')\n print(\' Note: This may require more targeted academic database searches\')\n\nfinal_analysis[\'authors_with_prior_publications\'] = authors_with_pubs\n\n# Save comprehensive results\nanalysis_file = \'workspace/pie_menus_complete_author_analysis.json\'\nwith open(analysis_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f\'\\nüíæ COMPLETE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {analysis_file}\')\nprint(f\'\\nüìà FINAL STATISTICS:\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Authors identified: {len(validated_authors)}\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Authors with pre-2015 publications: {len(authors_with_pubs)}\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Total search strategies used: {len(search_strategies) * len(validated_authors) if validated_authors else 0}\')\nprint(f\' ‚Ä¢ Analysis success: {"‚úÖ Complete" if len(validated_authors) > 0 else "‚ùå Incomplete"}\')\n\nprint(\'\\n=== COMPREHENSIVE AUTHOR RESEARCH COMPLETE ===\')',
"description": "This revised implementation addresses the critical issue from the previous attempt by implementing a much more robust author extraction approach. Instead of relying on hardcoded lowercase searches, I'm now using: (1) Multiple regex patterns to capture various author name formats including 'Authors:', 'by', citation formats, and name patterns, (2) Manual extraction logic for known variations of Pietro Murano and Iram N. Khan, (3) Validation against high-confidence sources with relevance scores >= 8. The code first inspects the search results file structure, then systematically analyzes the top 10 findings using comprehensive pattern matching. For each identified author, I implement multiple search strategies to find pre-2015 publications including direct searches with date restrictions, academic database searches, and Google Scholar queries. The code extracts publication years using multiple regex patterns, validates author mentions in results, and categorizes findings by confidence level. All results are consolidated into a comprehensive analysis showing which authors had prior publications before the 2015 target paper, with detailed publication counts, earliest years, and confidence assessments.",

Khan' as authors, but the regex patterns used for extraction were capturing generic text fragments like 'Which Is Better', 'Pie Menus or', etc. instead of actual author names. Khan'. Recommended fix: Revise author extraction to use targeted academic author patterns and examine the original successful search results that explicitly mention the authors.",

Khan ... Whether this figure ...\n relevance_score: <class \'int\'> - 3...\n relevance_indicators: <class \'list\'> - [\'pie_menu\', \'linear_menu\', \'2015\']...\n rank: <class \'int\'> - 1...\n\n================================================================================\nSTEP 2: ADVANCED AUTHOR EXTRACTION FROM SEARCH RESULTS\n================================================================================\nANALYZING HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS FOR AUTHOR INFORMATION:\n------------------------------------------------------------\n\n1.
